question: Which of the following should be avoided in the average human diet?

choices.option: More than 800 IU of vitamin D.

choices.explain: This is genetic material, it is in all foods we eat, and we need it to make our own genetic code.
Carbs are an important energy source, a carb-free diet has many unpleasant side effects and is ultimately ineffective.
Glutamate is harmless (and gives food a savory taste). The sodium makes it easier to be used in food. Moderate amounts of MSG is harmless.
